Food is very tasty, so I give them that. The tip is automatically included on the bill: 18.50% tip. The service is what you'd expect an old restaurant in Chinatown to have with no frills, but quite authentic. Note that it's a cash-only establishment.

Every time Iâ€™m in New York, this restaurant is at the top of my list. The food is consistently flavorful, comforting, and memorable.

Start with the soup. Every soup here is delicious, and they serve it with light, crispy chips and a little side of sweet and sour sauce for dippingâ€”itâ€™s the perfect beginning to the meal.

Then add the egg rolls. These are a must-have. The cabbage inside has the perfect crunchâ€”never soggy or sloppyâ€”and the flavors are balanced and satisfying.

For the main dish, go for the pork lo mein. The portion is hearty enough to feed two people, but the flavor is so good youâ€™ll want it all for yourself. Of course, the menu is full of amazing choices, but this is a go-to favorite.

I bring friends and family here every time I visit, and itâ€™s always a hit. It also makes me smile that my ex-husband, Anthony Bourdain, visited several timesâ€”his photos are proudly displayed on the walls, adding to the restaurantâ€™s charm and history.

This spot is truly a gem, and I canâ€™t recommend it enough.
Fast and efficient service. Great reasonably priced food. Cash only basis and they automatically charge 20% tip on your bill so be careful.
They have the best fried rice I ever had in my life.

AWFUL SERVICE!! There is a mandatory gratuity included on the check which is illegal if undisclosed!! The restaurant did not disclose this on the menu or a sign, and they are also cash only.
I had enough cash to cover the food and about half of the tip, but this wasnâ€™t good enough and the manager yelled at us to go to the atm down the street and cough up the extra $7. Why should we tip the staff for being so rude and cheap? Not to mention, they served us the wrong entrees and we had to send them back for our actual orders.

What a terrible way to do business!! It is such a shame since my family and I have eaten here for decades.

Authentic Chinatown experience.
Haven't been here in a decade and it's as delicious as I remembered.

I did the Shu Opp Duck and the brown sauce is truly a delight. The duck was tender and juicy ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

This establishment consistently delivers exceptional dining experiences. The menu remains consistent, and the service is impeccable. The prices are reasonably affordable for downtown New York City. Notably, Chinese restaurants in Las Vegas Springs Mountain area are surprisingly more expensive and smaller servings nowadays.ğŸ˜³
Old-school Cantonese with huge portions.

As someone who grew up eating Cantonese food, I can say with confidence that Hop Kee is a true Chinatown classic. This place is a real gem, with a traditional, no-frills atmosphere that feels both authentic and super cozy.

The food is absolutely incredible. We were blown away by the amazing sautÃ©ed spinach and the delicious Cantonese-style crabs. The Chow Fun is a can't-miss, definitely ask for recommendations, as they'll steer you in the right direction! The prices are fantastic, and you get a lot of delicious food for your money.

On top of that, the service is excellent. Everyone was very attentive and made our experience even better.

Just a heads-up, make sure you bring cash, as this cozy spot is cash-only.
A must stop in China Town

Old school Chinese food done well, no fusion here. A little noisy and space is classic Chinatown. We had dumplings, garlic chicken, chicken with black bean sauce, and moo shoo duck. All were delicious and portions are shareable.

One of the most iconic Chinese food restaurants in New York city. If you want authentic Chinese food this place is it. They have been open for so many years still doing the same traditional things ever since I've known this place as a kid. I hope they never change and I hope they stay open forever. This is a true NYC Chinatown restaurant.

This place is easy to miss!
But don't skip it!! Everything on the menu is a good choice.
Service was fast and friendly!
Very mediocre touristy Chinese food.
Lost for words,  Next time in Chinatown,  I will not pass this Gem up.

We did not finish our food and asked Chen to place our left over to take home boxes, when we got home our pork dish is missing. The pork dish is the one we barely touched and weâ€™re looking forward to eat it at home but they forgot to giveâ€¦

One of the best Cantonese restaurants weâ€™ve had the pleasure of trying! Hot, fresh, and delicious. We got egg drop soup, steamed pork dumplings, roast pork mei fun, and moo goo gai pan - which were all great! Service is wonderful and we had no problem walking in to eat around 5:30 on a Saturday afternoon must visit if youâ€™re in the area!
Well this is like a vintage restaurant. People are likely to keep coming back even though they waited for almost 30 minutes still patiently waiting to be in to dine in

Probably the best beef chow fun in Chinatown, excellent quality from the noodles to the beef. I grew up eating Cantonese food in Canton and yet, this is top notch. And you can see families and seniors eating here, which already indicates how good this place is

This place is a hidden gem. It may not look like the fanciest place, but the food and service is certainly amazing and there's rarely any wait for a table. My only complaint is that it's not very kid friendly as there is no kids menu. Overall, this restaurant is an amazing visit despite its odd exterior.
